captions.text:
Cameraman Valentin Pavlov
Music by Isaak Dunayevsky

Dasha - Klara Luchko
Fedya - Boris Andreyev

Long and wide's the Kuban river,
Wave is chasing after wave.

Wheat and rye crops
in the fields here
Whisper we will win the day.
They will work from dusk till morn.
And will fill this country's granary
With a million tons of corn.

Why sing so sorrowfully? Doesn't
the steppe gladden your hearts?

Look at those stacks!
Such harvest!

They holler so that
the oxen are stunned.

Drive on or we'll be late
for the fair.
Six versts an hour at most.

- You're still alone.
- When will you find a man?

- There's no man.
- Tell me another.

The eye sees
but the tooth can't reach.

- We'll help you.
- Just say the word.

Forget it. I've got much work to do
without the man around.

She surely has a good head
on her shoulders.

Beautiful, clever
but no husband, no kids.
Beware of widowship and a fire!

I'd rather lose a home in a fire
than be a widow.

- Good day, comrade Voron.
- Good day.

- Good day, Gordei Gordeevich.
- How do you know me?

They are ours. We're from
the 'Lenin's Commandments' farm.

- It's for sale.
- We've got thousands.

We've won the Red Banner
in a competition!

Yes, I know. You've got
a smart leader, Galina.

My compliments, Galina.
You know me?
Of course, I know you, Gordei.

- I could see you miles away.
- Am I that outstanding?

It's for kicks.
I'm a Cossack, ain't I?

Cossacks don't wear
a mustache anymore.
I may even grow a beard, if I want.

You may even grow
a plait, if you want.

But given your big ways,
you need a Moskvich or a Pobeda.
How do you know about our ways?

The farm will soon be
fully electrified.

- Really?
- Come and see for yourself.

Why did you break
my heart again?

I can't forget you
try as I may.

You have not changed, you have
not changed, my darling,
But I like you the way you are.

- Gee! I know him.
- Which one?

Hi, girls.
Where are you heading?

- Where d'you come from?
- We're lonely and unhooked.

We're looking for what
we haven't lost.
Hey, stay away from my produce.

You're rude
and we could be buyers.
Watch me getting the best one.

You go this way,
we go that way.
Go while the going is good.
See you at the fair, pop.
for the opening of the fair!

- Over there.
- I don't see her.

Let me tell you
the good news.
such a bumper crop as this year.

We can congratulate ourselves
on this great achievement.

This is a holiday
of dedicated labor.

We'll sum up the results
of the socialist competition.

attend sports events
and horse tournaments.
I wish you luck and success.
with a guarantee of six months.

Oh, no, not us.
Let's have some beer.

- I don't drink. Liver you know.
- Liver?
You still go around cossacking, eh?
I gave the country what I owed
and can have a spree, okay?
This is our heroine Dasha Shelest.

They'll get married
and leave your collective farm.

We've got our own eligible men.
Right, Dasha?

No answer... Well, have a good time.
But don't look at strangers.
The region rings with your fame.

- My head is spinning.
- Any buys?

- No, just window shopping.
- Right, have a good look first.

- Bye. I must be off.
- Bye.

- What about the collars?
- I'll buy them.

- Where are you staying?
- Near the racecourse.
Voron's broght new racers this time.

- Ours aren't worse.
- See you next morning.

- Have a good time.
- And the collars?
Hey, buddy, is it the trading spot

- You bet.
- Can I see Dasha?

- Is that you, pop?
- Yeah, that's us.

Never fry a fish
till it is caught.

Words are not birds -
out you let them
and back you never get them.
You can't get me with your rhymes.

I can make a report in verse,
right here.

Fedya, put this agent out
of the way.
Now get the hell outa here.

Serge, find Gordei Gordeevich
and tell him
the situation is not so good.
acted in unison at the fairs.

We always fixed prices
and controled the situation.
Do I know the situation, Marko?

- Who does if you don't.
- Smart aleck.

Collective farm trade
is a public matter

- And increase farm revenues!
- Hear, hear.

- We sell cheap.
- At a loss.

sells its produce at 25% less
than we do.

- Hear that, Gordei?
- I'm not deaf.

- That's a how-do-you-do!
- Galina has outgalinaed us.
She must be out of her mind.

What's wrong with them?
Standard collars.

- I can see that.
- What do you want?

- You and your products!
- You're asking too much.

No, I'm not. I'm going to complain
to the fair committee.

- No big deal.
- You'll be thrown out.

They are no good for men,
let alone horses.
And you say they don't fit.

May your heart trouble you
all your life!

- Look at him!
- Don't move I said.

- Did you try it on your head?
- It's standard.
You should be tried for it.
I need to talk to you.

- She's collared him alright.
- You bet.
We control pricing at the fair.

- Me not modest?
- You make much noise.
It's my voice, not my fault.

- Control your voice.
- Should I whisper or what?

No, I am not.
You disappoint me.

but you don't know
the new situation.

- What?
- Isn't that a bit thick?

Anton says the situation
isn't good.

What kind of a situation
do you have?

Only Galina is selling. We're
nibbling sunflower seeds.

Look, it's perishable.
We can go bust.

Dasha Shelest, see your 2 friends
at the movie theater entrance.
A liking may come of it.
They met on the way to the fair.
Then came here and dropped hints.

They are actually
from Galina's farm.

So you mean to outdo me here too,
Galina?

- Go do your job.
- Mind the board!

Galina's guys want to grab
our best girl.
And you won't lift a finger.

I've tried this and that
but Dasha couldn't care less.

Court her, try to win her,
fight for her.

You are a Cossack!
If I were your age...
Don't tear your eyes off her.

Buy her icecream, take her
to the merry-go-round or movies.

Buy a tie and a hat,
curl your forelock.
Well, you know what I mean.

You'll unswer
with your life for Dasha.

- Go do it.
- I'll have a go at it.
if I know the situation or not.
You will be surprised to know:
By 30% did we scale down prices
to make our produce nicer and nicer.

You are welcome to our kiosk,
we have all for what you ask.

- Like an actor.
- I AM an actor.
We've been looking for you all day.

- Where are you hiding?
- We've been shopping.

- Hang on. Wait.
- No, we'll be late.

- Adieu. You may drop a line.
- Thank you. You're so kind.

The address is the wide world,
the anonymous farm board.

Yes, I'm sure.
Let us go for a walk.
No, we can not even talk.

At the post office your letters
are awaiting us. Good luck.

- We are going your way.
- How strange. What d'ya say?

To the world's end we'tll go
Just to be with you. And so...

- Am I right, Fedya?
- You are.
In that case just to spite you
We will go to the zoo.

- To the zoo?
- To the zoo.

- Why stop in your tracks?
- We are truly outa breath.

To get our wind back
let's sit down

My treat, I pay.
Have your fill, pray.
That I am, I'm proud to say.

your two friends
at the movie theater entrance.

- She'll hear it.
- Yeah, but will she want to come?

She will. The radio is
a great invention.

We have two tickets
to the cinema.

- I pay double.
- Sorry, just two.

Well, guys, we are going
to see the movie.

- The best seats.
- I'm not sure.

That guy, what's his name...
the agent.

What's that?
I pay for the tickets,

they go with our girls
and you say nothing.
I can't possibly fight, can I?
I'm in love with a fellow.
As ill luck would have it,
I fell in love with him.
I'm hard put for words - Oh!

He has no idea,
not a single clue.
But the young woman's love - O!
Keep them in your range of vision.
Take you to my collective farm.
Why yours? I have my farm.
The dancers work on the farm

He's my manager. A great guy.
There's no one like him.

Don't brag, Gordei.
I hate bragging.

This is Vasya, my horse breeder.
There's no one like him.

- Not again?
- All right, all right.

- Where's your buddy?
- Why do you ask?

He took our Masha...
er... Dasha.

- Good for him.
- It's your fault. Where's she?

The girl is seeking happiness,
don't stand in her way.

Don't unnerve me.
It's my number now.

Marko, Nekai,
they are all mine.
I kept an eye on them but--
And I can't possibly force them.

I must lift weights
and set records.

- Good music.
- It's my friend playing.

He's great.
We breed horses together.

- We have lots of them.
- We too.

I'm a team leader.
I deal with grain.

- I know.
- It was hard this year.
The winter crops were in danger.

The crops are ripe
for harvesting but no.

- Hard work yours.
- Not hard, troublesome.

I met you on the train.
Remember?

- Yes. You met me - and forgot.
- I tried to find you.

You didn't try hard
since you didn't find me.

What's that for?
I was thinking about you.

- When I saw you yesterday--
- You didn't even say hi.
I couldn't. We were not introduced.
First of all we'd like to thank

Hey, you don't bow well,
Nikanorovna.

It's because I have a swell,
Christoforovna.

When we came to the fair
We went shoppin' around there.

A dress length we were offered
made us cry 'Oh my God.'

No good for our region,
Christoforovna.

Dressed in golden crepe de Chine,
Clasping at the Moskvich wheel,

I'll speed past old and young
Across my collective farm.

Soviet woman at the wheel,
Nikanorovna?

They can reach the Kremlin hill,
Christoforovna.

This oft happens, I grant that,
But you never should forget:

If the engine sud'nly fails,
Traffic jams'll be everywhere.

And there is another thing,
Christoforovna...

You may run outa benzine,
Nikanorovna.

Voron here told his aide:
'I will teach'em how to trade.'

And - can you believe it? -
A situation came out of it.

What are we to make of this,
Christoforovna?

Why'd he raise that price of his,
Nikanorovna?

At the saddler's, where we were,
There are shortcoming's galore.

Their horse collars and all -
True! - are no good at all.

For a horse they are too tight,
Christoforovna.

I am sure you are right,
Nikanorovna.

Their horse collars and all -
True! - are no good at all.

We sing of cocks
and hens and birds.

What birds, dear? Come on say,
Nikanorovna.

You all know their names,
Christoforovna.

Galka-Daw and Voron-Crow
Are both perched on a bow.

He is casting sheepish glances
At his turtle dove Oh!

But you can not tame a crow,
Christoforovna.

He'll be tamed before you know,
Nikanorovna.

Speaking of the tongues that wag,
Christoforovna...

They got quite outa hand,
Nikanorovna.

Leaves in spring are all green,
Leaves in autumn will get auburn.

Guys in spring are footloose,
Guys in autumn will get noosed.

They will go on wedding sprees,
Nikanorovna,

All hell will break loose,
Christoforovna.

Oak-tree and rowan-tree in a grove
stand side by side.

Our Voron and Galina
very soon'll be man and wife.

Why do they keep it secret,
Nikanorovna?

They don't know about it,
Christoforovna.
Sang and danced for you right here
So the gifts can be developed

All the avenues are opened
to the ordinary folks.

Amateurs become quite often
Profies in all life walks.

Now give us a big hand,
Give us our due
And in wrapping up the show
We say ciao and thank you.

- About the horse collars?
- It's true.

Those collars are only good
for mules' heads.

- You mean I'm a mule?
- Oh no.

You have a low opinion of yourself,
comrade Voron.

Not me, but those who write
all sorts of songs about me.
to have a word with you.

Attention! Attention! Now see
weight-lifters in action!
Strongmen were only found in Rus.

Russia has many men
that are strong.

Hey, where's Dasha?
Why are you alone?
She won't even look at me.
Put it back and go find her.

And mind you: you answer
with your life for Dasha.

Okay, I'll try again.
Hope you won't regret it.
Voron is no relation of mine.
I was orphaned in the war
So much for my short life.

Your life is long
and interesting.
Long? But I am not yet 20.

So what! Some guys live to be
a hundred and do nothing.
Oh, I forgot to tell you.
I was in Moscow last year.

Walked along its streets, rode
in the metro, went to the theatre,

circus and planetarium.
But all the time I longed

As soon as I saw you,
I decided--
You are the best in the whole world.
I told you not to pine for me.

- I'll talk to him.
- Yes, do.

- Kolya, let's go to a dance.
- Let's.

- You're late. It's over.
- We'll make it.

If Fedya wasn't on stage now,
we'd have given it to you...
Our women have married you off.

Galina.
She'll cut off your mustache.

- Pardon?
- She doesn't like a mustache.
Who says I'm gonna marry her?

How interesting. Everybody knows
and I don't.
let's show them how we can dance.

That dancing dame
who is laughing?
I was lovesick before the war.
How does she return my love?

She put a horse collar on me.
Disgraced me with those prices.

Her hen-maids or goose-maids
sing songs about me
She even called me a mule
It's all a big joke to her.
And you took it lying down, eh?

What could I do?
She is a woman.

Hey, Marko! And where is
your friend Gordei?
It's not right, not the Soviet way.

- Me a crooked little dame?
- Who else?

Who's floating the wedding rumor?
Who is disgracing him?
to be of interest to such a woman?
I'm not in step with the times...

To be, or not to be --
That is the question.

Whether 'tis nobler in the mind
to suffer the slings and arrows

of outrageous fortune, or to take
arms against a sea of troubles...

in thy orisons be all my sins
rememb'red.
I am not. These are great words.

You are an actor.
A real actor!

- All first prizes are ours.
- You wish.
What do you say, Galina Ermolayevna?
It's a life or death matter for him.

- How's Globus? Still limping?
- Not anymore.

- He can race.
- Okay, let him race.

- He must put it out of his head.
- He might.

- But not out of his heart.
- He'll survive.

- He'll pine away.
- We'll send him to a resort.
Why don't you give your consent?

I can't. Voron will be mad.
We're trying to win over his worker.
But she's a Hero of Socialist Labor!

Then Nikolai'll go to work
for Voron. Ciao.

- How do you mean?
- He will.

He's shy, she's shy
and I have to pay.

It's sheer hell for me
to talk to Voron.
Don't let us down at fancy riding.

As to your Dasha,
after yesterday's fiasco...

You promised to do the shopping
with us.

- That's about all.
- What about the piano?

- What'll the board say?
- They'll sanction it.

- Would you like to hear the tone?
- Can you play?

Do play. I've heard him
only on the radio.

Good piano.
Emil would be jealous.
Could you play some quiet music?

Some guys have a club, a stadium
and are gonna buy a piano.
And you're sitting on your millions.

- We grew up without pianos.
- You - yes, but not us.

- Let's go, I can't bear to see it.
- Let's.
A couple of oxen cost less.
I need to talk to you.

- It's about the wedding.
- Whose wedding?

- We're in for a wedding.
- We?

- Yes, as chairmen.
- Whose wedding is it?

- You have the girl.
- I do?
Are you in your right mind?
It's love. We should help them.

- Hey!
- What can I do for you?
Stop sneezing, start doing your job.

Forget it.
We'll never give you Dasha.

You forget it.
You've no heart.
I can give them culture too!
And don't sell it to anyone!

- Trade's in full swing.
- Hold it.
pay the bill and get the piano.

We should know the cultural needs
of youth.

Find Dasha and take her
to the hotel.

It's not marriage,
it's daylight robbery!

I wonder how Galina
managed to buy you.
Take Vasya. He's a nice lad.
His picture is in a mag.

- His and mine!
- You see? It's fate.

Vasya is a great performer
and dancer!

He'll make mincemeat
of your Nikolai today.

You've no faith
in your collective farm!
but Nikolai can't lose to Vasya!

- You know me, right?
- Yes, I know you.
I give you to him, myself.

- And if he doesn't?
- Then put off your wedding

You're not afraid to remain single,
are you?
You're the best catch in the region.
A better guy may turn up. A prince.

- No one can be better.
- It depends.
I say this as your father.

If you hurt my feelings
I won't come to your wedding.

- Can you keep your word?
- I can. Can you?
Don't worry, it's in the bag.
We outdid tougher guys than Nick.

- Yes, you are.
- Not in the least.
I can't watch. You tell me.

Thank you on behalf
of the collective farm.

You belong in the circus
not the racecourse.

- Good for her.
- My brand of mettle.

- It's a female sport.
- See you're not blown off, aunty.
Poor Galina. It was a close shave.
I guess she lost to Voron

- But why?
- It's not that simple.

Pack up, guys.
Time for pleasure, time for work.
Next fall we'll take all prizes.

A dashing Cossack.
I love your likes.
But you'll move to our farm.

We'll give you a new house,
a garden, beehives.

The wife should go
to her man's place.
We'll do the other way around.
That's not to be sneezed at.
You too will be better off.
Our stud farm is larger than yours.
But Nikolai will live on our farm.

- But we gained time.
- We lost the cup.

- But we got a top rider.
- How do you mean?

Nikolai has asked Dasha
in marriage.

- I knew it.
- I don't mind.
But he must live on our farm.

- You're a shrewd diplomat.
- You bet.

- And?
- There's nothing they can do.

Galina has the honor
of inviting you to our farm

of Dasha and Nikolai,
with your assembly.

When they get married
you come to our farm.
in line with the marriage law...

She's now getting
into her cabriolet.

Hold her, Anton,
cry for the police!
But there will be no wedding.
Gone. They haven't come to terms.
Remember I told you the other day

First listen to what
Denis Stepanovich has to say.

And Dasha was raised
by you alone, right?

Would you mind telling me
in which country

- Answer me.
- In our Soviet country.

So why fret?
You should be happy.

- I'm gonna congratulate them.
- So Galina beat me here too.

The fair is laughing at Voron.
The region too.
Yes, yesterday. To me and Dergach.

- What's with you?
- Tell me in all earnest...

Yesterday in the presence
of Denis Stepanovich.

I asked why she kept
hurting you--

- I'd like to ask you...
- Ask me, Gordei.

Is it true what you said
to Marko?

- I said I love you.
- Galina!
It is not beyond the faraway oceans,
It is not beyond the thrice-ten land
Lady Fate, I'm saying with emotion,
Settled firmly in the Soviet land.

We had built our happy life
for years,
We had fought for it with our foes.

We had sought the Promised Land
and - cheers! -
Did we find it - everybody knows.

No strong and hot and dry wind -
Fancy! -

Will dry up the Russian hearts,
my friend.
Our country is a land of plenty,
We are doing for it our best.
Our future, so bright and happy,
And the sun is generously shining
Upon us who live in Soviet clime.
Ours is a happy lot and thriving
We will be until the end of time.

title: Кубанские казаки / The Cossacks of Kuban

comments.text: Игры﻿
comments.author: Василий Цыбулевский

comments.text:
Проблема этого пырьевского "шедевра" была в муляжах жратвы и показа 
счастливой жизни российской глубинки, когда на самом деле после войны, даже 
после отмены карточек, жрать было нечего. Форменное издевательство - так 
люди, по рассказам родителей, воспринимали это кино.﻿
comments.author: Haruki Shinonome

comments.text: To NIE JEST "kicz" ! To piękny MUSICAL z CUDOWNA MUZYKĄ Dunajewskiego !﻿
comments.author: Przemysław Szczygielski

comments.text:
Какие же раньше были хорошие фильмы...а теперь макруха и воры...будто в 
реале этого дерьма не хватает(﻿
comments.author: Евгений Гера

comments.text:
Китч, конечно, но никто же не утверждал, что это реальное отражение 
действительности. Сейчас смотрится бодро и весело.﻿
comments.author: LockedPig

comments.text:
Вполне очевидно что тот кто добавляет к русскому названию песни неумелый, 
да и, пожалуй, ненужный перевод на английский, чувствует  славянскую 
ущербность. Ведь никто из англоязычных не будет вставлять в свою речь 
русские слова, чтобы щегольнуть этим.﻿
comments.author: Vladymyr Koval

comments.text: Hyvä Elokuva!﻿
comments.author: Reijo Laaksonen

comments.text:
Этот гениальный фильм был создан во времена страшной послевоенной разрухи и 
голода. Люди из руин поднимали страну. Можно представить, какой большой 
моральной поддержкой для них был этот фильм! ﻿
comments.author: Павел Симпсон

comments.text:
В ГУЛАГах и тюрьмах тоже рождались дети, и немало... и что? Авантюризм 
гос.политики по освоению целины вовсе не исключает порядочность, трудолюбие 
и героизм отдельно взятых людей, втянутых в эту авантюру. Абсолютно уверен, 
что подавляющее их число было именно таковыми. К таким-же авантюрам 
относится и  БАМ, и к проекты переброски сибирских рек и пр. и пр...
comments.author: Сергей Хоменко

comments.text:
+Сергей Хоменко Знаешь, а рождение меня и моей сестры моими родителями, 
встретившимися на Целине - по твоим словам - получается глупейшая 
авантюра.. Историю надо видеть не примитивом плоских и бесчеловечных 
штампов. Будь умнее. не позорься и неси глупостей!
comments.author: Andrey Letyagin

comments.text: Кубань = Україна
comments.author: Опанас Розенбережженко

comments.text: +Сергей Хоменко пшел вон, сопливое чмо!
comments.author: борис Борисов

comments.text:
+Сергей Хоменко когда вы повзрослеете и поумнеете, будете рассуждать не 
столь категорично. Может быть.
comments.author: борис Борисов

comments.text:
+Опанас Розенбережженко Сало, Сало, Халва, Халва, Безвизовый въезд, 
Безвизовый въезд... Не надоело еще выставлять себя идиотами?
comments.author: борис Борисов

comments.text: Кубань = Україна
comments.author: Опанас Розенбережженко

comments.text:
Я как раз о знании истории и говорю. Мы просто знаем ее с разных сторон. 
Вот моя сторона знания такова.  Потому что для меня освоение целины - не 
трудовой подвиг - а одна из глупейших авантюр, а создание колхозов методом 
коллективизации - преступление перед человечеством - не меньшее чем 
освенциум или триблинка, потому что привело к гибели миллионов мирных 
людей. Мы по разному видим историю - вы в свете ностальгии по 
несостоявшемуся "светлому будущему", а я в в свете десятков миллионов 
невинно убиенных за это самое несостоявшееся "светлое будущее".
comments.author: Сергей Хоменко

comments.text:
+Сергей Хоменко Такие реплики даже читать противно. Да, это агитка, но в 
пользу светлого завтра, вселяющая в человека веру и дающая силы. Не в 
пример тому, что сейчас показывают и снимают: грязь, пошлость, 
предательство, разврат и алчность. Трудовые подвиги, это когда целину 
пахали и строили Магнитку, а не тогда, когда один жулик разорил другого и 
подгреб под себя его банк, дело, жену и проч. Это наше прошлое, наша 
история, которую надо знать. А сейчас бухают не меньше и, надо заметить, не 
все семгой и осетриной закусывают, некоторые по-прежнему килькой. Уважайте 
творчество других или создайте свой шедевр, который превзойдет данный!!!
comments.author: Елена Бобылева

comments.text:
Or perhaps it was demoralizing to see all this supposed "plenty" and 
abundance in stark contrast to how hard their own lives were. Seeing the 
stalls filled with goods and the people so well fed and happy might have 
reminded them of what they DID NOT have. Still, a great film.
comments.author: 1manuscriptman

comments.text:
Что тогда, что сейчас среди нормальных людей фильм воспринимался как 
плоская плакатная агитка. И относились к нему так-же.После работы растелят 
плакат, разложат ржавой кильки, забухают казенки и орут - "каким ты 
был...таким остался..." а утром, с бодуна, опять совершать "трудовые 
подвиги", последствия которых мы по сей день разгрести не можем... Наше 
сегодняшнее "прекрасное настоящее" полностью детерминировано нашим не менее 
"прекрасным героическим" прошлым,  с немалым вкладом и подобных 
 агит-"шедевров". Удачи нам всем в разгребании авгиевых конюшен 
прошлого...гАспада.
comments.author: Сергей Хоменко

comments.text: Классный фильм, смотрю его уже не один раз ﻿
comments.author: Was Ganina

comments.text: мой любимый фильм!!﻿
comments.author: Nastya Tikhomirnova

comments.text:
Композитор конечно гениальный.  Еще он, помнится, написал музыку к 
"Искателям счастья."  Тоже гениальную. ﻿
comments.author: Filiomena

comments.text: +Filiomena понимаю, и так все ясно
comments.author: Сергей Хоменко

comments.text:
+Сергей ХоменкоСережа,
Вы могли бы не приводить здесь Вагнера.
comments.author: Filiomena

comments.text:
+Filiomena Понимаю. Ностальгия. Мы ею к счастью не болеем. У нас другие 
проблемы... Война... Курс доллара... "Любимый брат" на севере... и его 
дикая пропаганда - похлеще чем агитки 50-х. И мы прекрасно понимаем за чью 
ностальгию по великому совку мы платим тысячами жизней украинцев, русских, 
евреев и тд... Поэтому для нас и Дунаевский звучит в несколько другой 
тональности. А таланта его никто не отрицает. Также как никто не отрицал 
талант Вагнера... просто не все пользователи их талантов далеко не всегда 
вели себя пристойно (очень мягко сказано).
comments.author: Сергей Хоменко

comments.text:
+Сергей ХоменкоМы из Америки, Сережа.  И мы хорошо помним Дунаевского и его 
музыку.
comments.author: Filiomena

comments.text:
Кто помнит "Искателей...", кто помнит ту музыку, кто помнит того

comments.author: Сергей Хоменко

comments.text:
Это была наша страна и Русская и Армянская и всех нас. Нет лучше 
Социализма, после расспада СССР - это становится яснее с каждым годом. Если 
убрать репрессии Сталина то лучшего времени не было. Всё было на сознании и 
на доброй воли к своему народу. Очень обидно за нас всех!!! Такую державу 
расстащили по клочкам.﻿
comments.author: Alex Kocharov

comments.text:
Правду выбирает каждый сам.в любое время и в любом строе. Дальше работают

comments.text: Союз лучшее что было и возможно будет в истории.

наркоманами, ни со своей гейрашей. Это ваш и только ваш совковый удел тихо

comments.text:
There are a LOT of decorations, both military and civilian, on the chests 
of the cast. About half of them are wearing the Order of Lenin and Hero of 
Labor, and I believe some had The Order of Labor Glory. If you are bored 
and have nothing else to do, you might waste time trying to figure out what 
our superheroes are wearing. Miltary goes on the right lapel, civilian on 
the left. You might make a drinking game of it.﻿
comments.author: 1manuscriptman

comments.text:
In light of the horrible deprivation taking place in the Kuban, and indeed 
all of Russia in 1949, I have always viewed this movie as tragic despite 
its beauty, or perhaps because of it. It must have hurt the Cossacks to 
watch this piece of propaganda with empty bellies, no matter how well made 
the movie is.

Please folks, don't give me the Socialist Paradise line on this one. I have 
taught Communist Political Systems at University, and I also appeal to 
common sense. How many farmers anywhere sing"We work our butts off and our 
happy to do it, as the Government takes our grain away!" By the way: This 
is  years after WW2. Anyone see a maimed former soldier here?﻿
comments.author: 1manuscriptman

comments.text:
WWII was on the territory of the USSR, there were many ruined citieas and 
villages. Many people died while the war. This movie was filmed as 
propaganda but I was made exactly after the WWII and was oriented to bring 
hope to people that the future would be wealthy and peaceful.
comments.author: Wolqos

comments.text: Хороший фильм,ужасный интернет
comments.author: Илья Вербицкий

comments.text:
It only words. The facts deny you. Read about children's death rate, Life 
expectancy. The Standard of living. Free available school training and free 
available medicine for all people in the USSR already in 1930th years.
comments.author: Я НЕЯ

comments.text:
In 1932-33 people were starving to death by the millions on those same 
fields shown in this film. Stalin's collectivization did the job. By the 
way Kuban Cossacks are the descendants of the Ukrainian Zaporozhian 
Cossacks who settled Kuban after Catherine the not so great destroyed their 
last Sich in 1775

comments.text:
@N0rwayFTW If you will skip through "Gone with the wind" you will see 
people running and crying, if you'll skip trough "How to steel a million" 
you will get nothing too. And so on. Watch the full muvie and don't post 
stupid comments. P.S. And the movie is really great. It shows how people 
can work and reach the targets, how to survive in hard times. And how to be 
happy to do it.

comments.text:
Хотелось бы иметь возможность посмотреть необрезанный фильм с оригинальными 
аудио и визуальными одами Сталину, потому что у кого то может сложится 
ошибочное мнение что эта лента отражает советскую действительность а не 
является обыкновенным советским агитпропом.
